<P ID=PARA7137 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7136 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
<I>
	Shareholder Litigation and Demands
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7138 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7139 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company and its former Chief Executive Officer Charles Dunleavy are defendants in consolidated securities class action lawsuits pending in the United States District Court for the District of New Jersey captioned
<I>
	In Re: Ocean Power Technologies, Inc. Securities Litigation,
</I>
	Civil Action No. 14-3799 (FLW) (LHG). The consolidated actions are
<I>
	Roby v. Ocean Power Technologies, Inc., et al.
</I>
	, Case No. 3:14-cv-03799-FLW-LHG (filed June 13, 2014);
<I>
	Chew, et al. v. Ocean Power Technologies, Inc. et. al.
</I>
	, Case No 3:14-cv-03815 (filed June 13, 2014);
<I>
	Konstantinidis v. Ocean Power Technologies, Inc., et al.
</I>
	, Case No. 3:14-cv-04015 (filed June 23, 2014); and
<I>
	Turner v. Ocean Power Technologies, Inc., et al.,
</I>
	Case No. 3:14-cv-04592 (filed July 22, 2014). On March 17, 2015, the court entered an order appointing Five More Special Situation Fund Ltd. as the lead plaintiff.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7140 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 22.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7141 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On October 9, 2015, the lead plaintiff filed a third amended class action complaint which alleges claims for violations of sections 12(a) (2) and 15 of the Securities Act of 1933 and for violations of &#167;10(b) and &#167;20(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 arising out of public statements relating to the Company&#8217;s technology and a now terminated agreement between Victorian Wave Partners Pty. Ltd. (VWP) and the Australian Renewable Energy Agency (ARENA) for the development of a wave power station (the "VWP Project"). The third amended class action complaint seeks unspecified monetary damages and other relief. On November 5, 2015, defendants filed a motion to dismiss the third amended class action complaint. The lead plaintiff filed a brief in opposition to the motion on December 7, 2015, and defendants filed a reply in support of the motion on December 21, 2015. The Court has not yet ruled on the motion. On May 5, 2016, the parties entered into a Stipulation and Agreement of Class Settlement (&#8220;Stipulation&#8221;) in which they agreed to a settlement of the consolidated securities class action lawsuits, subject to Court approval. The Stipulation provides, among other things, for a settlement payment by or on behalf of the Company of $3,000,000 in cash, of which the Company will pay $500,000 and the Company&#8217;s insurer will pay $2,500,000, and the issuance by the Company of 380,000 shares (valued at $596,000 on the date the Stipulation was signed by the parties) of its Common Stock to the class members. In connection with the settlement, the parties have agreed to execute mutually agreeable releases. On June 7, 2016, the Court entered an Order Granting Preliminary Approval of Settlement. The Court has scheduled a hearing for November 14, 2016 to determine, among other things, whether to grant final approval of the settlement. The amounts agreed in the Stipulation agreement, including the amount to be contributed by our insurance carrier, have been reflected in the Company&#8217;s Consolidated Financial Statements as of April 30, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7142 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 22.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK3301 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR3301 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM3301 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-25
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage79"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR3301 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA3301.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7143 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On July 10, 2014, the Company received a demand letter ("Demand Letter") from an attorney claiming to represent a shareholder demanding that the Company&#39;s Board of Directors establish an independent committee to investigate and remedy alleged breaches of fiduciary duties by the Board of Directors and management relating to the VWP Project. The Company invited the attorney to participate in the Section 220 Demand process discussed below. On February 6, 2015, the Company produced documents to the attorney pursuant to a confidentiality agreement in connection with the Section 220 Demand process.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7144 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7145 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company also received a letter, dated August 19, 2014, (the "Section 220 Demand") from another attorney claiming to represent a shareholder demanding, pursuant to 8 Del. C. &#167;220, to inspect certain books and records of the Company relating to the VWP Project and the termination of Charles Dunleavy as the Company&#39;s Chief Executive Officer. The Company has received two additional Section 220 Demands relating to the same subject matter from attorneys claiming to represent two different shareholders. The Company has responded in writing to the three Section 220 Demands and on February 6, 2015 produced documents to each of the attorneys pursuant to confidentiality agreements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7146 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 22.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7147 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company and certain of its current and former directors and officers are defendants in a derivative lawsuit filed on March 18, 2015 in the United States District Court for the District of New Jersey captioned
<I>
	Labare v. Dunleavy, et. al.,
</I>
	Case No. 3:15-cv-01980-FLW-LHG. The derivative complaint alleges claims for breach of fiduciary duty, abuse of control, gross mismanagement and unjust enrichment relating to the now terminated agreement between VWP and ARENA referred to above. The derivative complaint seeks unspecified monetary damages and other relief. On May 18, 2015, the plaintiff and all the defendants agreed to stay the derivative lawsuit pending action in the consolidated class action securities litigation discussed above (namely, a court order denying any motions to dismiss the commencement of discovery, a joint request to lift the stay, or further order of the court).
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7148 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 22.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7149 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On July 10, 2015, a second derivative lawsuit, captioned
<I>
	Rywolt v. Dunleavy, et al.
</I>
	, Case No. 3:15-cv-05469, was filed by another shareholder against the same defendants in the United States District Court for the District of New Jersey alleging similar claims for breach of fiduciary duty, gross mismanagement, abuse of control, and unjust enrichment relating to the now terminated agreement between VWP and ARENA. The Rywolt complaint also seeks unspecified monetary damages and other relief. On September 2, 2015, the plaintiff and all the defendants agreed to stay the Rywolt derivative lawsuit pending action in the consolidated class action securities litigation discussed above (namely, a court order denying any motions to dismiss the commencement of discovery, a joint request to lift the stay, or further order of the court). In addition, on September 2, 2015, the plaintiffs in the Labare and Rywolt derivative lawsuits filed an unopposed motion to consolidate the two actions. On February 8, 2016, the Court entered an order (i) consolidating the Labare and Rywolt actions; (ii) appointing Labare and Rywolt as co-lead plaintiffs; (iii) appointing The Rosen Law Firm P.C. as lead counsel; and (iv) directing the co-lead plaintiffs to file a consolidated amended complaint within 30 days of the order. The co-lead plaintiffs filed a consolidated complaint on March 9, 2016. Defendants have not responded to the consolidated complaint because of the pending stay.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7150 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 22.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7151 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On April 21, 2016, a third derivative lawsuit, captioned
<I>
	LaCalamito v. Dunleavy, et al.
</I>
	, Case No. 3:16-cv-02249, was filed by another shareholder against certain current and former directors and officers of the Company in the United States District Court for the District of New Jersey alleging similar claims for breach of fiduciary duty relating to the now terminated agreement between VWP and ARENA. The LaCalamito complaint seeks unspecified monetary damages and other relief. The Company has not been formally served and has not yet responded to the complaint.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7152 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 22.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7153 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On June 9, 2016, a fourth derivative lawsuit, captioned
<I>
	Pucillo v. Dunleavy, et al.
</I>
	, was filed by another shareholder against certain current and former directors and officers of the Company in the United States District Court for the District of New Jersey alleging similar claims for breach of fiduciary duty, unjust enrichment, and&nbsp; abuse of control relating to the now terminated agreement between VWP and ARENA. The Pucillo complaint seeks unspecified monetary damages and other relief.&nbsp; The Company has not been formally served and has not yet responded to the complaint.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7154 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 22.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7155 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company and certain of its current directors are defendants in a lawsuit filed by an alleged shareholder in the Superior Court of New Jersey, Mercer County Chancery Division on January 25, 2016, captioned Stern v. Ocean Power Technologies, Inc., et al., Civil Action No. C-5-16. The complaint alleges that certain provisions of the Company&#8217;s&nbsp;Certificate of Incorporation and By-laws providing that the Company&#8217;s directors may be removed only for cause and only by an affirmative vote of at least 75% of the votes which all the stockholders would be entitled to cast in any annual election of directors are invalid under Section 141(k) of the Delaware General Corporation Law. The Complaint asserts a breach of fiduciary claim against the director defendants and a declaratory judgment claim against all defendants seeking, among other things, to invalidate the current provisions and declare that the Company&#8217;s directors may be removed and replaced without cause and by a simple majority vote. The Complaint seeks declaratory and injunctive relief as well as unspecified costs and attorneys&#8217; fees. Defendants have not yet responded to the Complaint. By Unanimous Written Consent dated June 17, 2016, the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors amended the Company&#8217;s By-laws to delete the &#8220;only for cause&#8221; requirement, thereby allowing for removal of directors with or without cause by the Company&#8217;s stockholders.&nbsp; In addition, the Board proposed, subject to approval by the Company&#8217;s stockholders at the next annual general meeting of stockholders, a similar amendment to the director removal provision in the Company&#8217;s&nbsp;Certificate of Incorporation.&nbsp; On June 22, 2016, the parties to this lawsuit submitted a Stipulation and Proposed Order Staying Proceedings that (1) stays the case pending the stockholder vote on the proposed amendment to the Company&#8217;s&nbsp;Certificate of Incorporation; (2) provides for dismissal of the action with prejudice if the stockholders approve the amendment, subject to plaintiff&#8217;s right to make a fee application to the court and defendants&#8217; right to oppose any such application; and (3) provides for the stay to be lifted and the action to resume, without waiver of any parties&#8217; rights, if the stockholders do not approve the amendment.&nbsp;The Court approved the Stipulation on June 30, 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7156 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ID=PGBK3302 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID=PGFTR3302 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<DIV ID=PGNUM3302 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
	F-26
</DIV>
<HR STYLE="HEIGHT: 2PX; WIDTH: 100%; PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; COLOR: #000000" NOSHADE="">
<A NAME="eolPage80"></A>
<DIV ID=PGHDR3302 STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA3302.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7157 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
<I>
	Employment Litigation
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7159 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7160 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On June 10, 2014, the Company announced that it had terminated Charles Dunleavy as its Chief Executive Officer and as an employee of the Company for cause, effective June 9, 2014, and that Mr. Dunleavy had also been removed from his position as Chairman of the Board of Directors. On June 17, 2014, Mr. Dunleavy wrote to the Company stating that he had retained counsel to represent him in connection with an alleged wrongful termination of his employment. On July 28, 2014, Mr. Dunleavy resigned from the Board and the boards of directors of the Company&#39;s subsidiaries. The Company and Mr. Dunleavy have agreed to suspend his alleged employment claims pending resolution of the shareholder litigation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7161 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 22.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7162 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Except for the Stipulation agreement noted previously, we have not established any provision for losses relating to these claims and pending litigation. Due to the stages of these proceedings, and considering the inherent uncertainty of these claims and litigation, at this time we are not able to predict or reasonably estimate whether we have any possible loss exposure or the ultimate outcome of these claims.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7163 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 22.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7165 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
<I>
	SEC Subpoena
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7166 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
<I>
	&nbsp;
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7167 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On February 4, 2015, the Company received a subpoena from the SEC requesting information related to the VWP Project. The Company has provided information to the SEC in response to that subpoena.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	As part of the same investigation, on July 12, 2016, the SEC issued a second subpoena requesting information related to the Company&#8217;s April 4, 2014 public offering and we are working to respond to that subpoena.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The SEC investigation is ongoing and the Company continues to cooperate with the SEC in its investigation. We are unable to predict what action, if any, might be taken by the SEC or its staff as a result of this investigation or what impact, if any, the cost of responding to the SEC&#8217;s investigation or its ultimate outcome might have on our financial position, results of operations or liquidity. We have not established any provision for losses relating to this matter.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7168 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7169 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
<I>
	Spain IVA (sales tax)
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7170 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7171 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	In June 2012, the Company received notice that the Spanish tax authorities are inquiring into its 2010 IVA (value-added tax) filing for which the Company benefitted from the offset of approximately $250,000 of input tax. The Company believes that the inquiry will find that the tax credit was properly claimed and, therefore, no liability has been recorded. The Company issued letters of credit in the amount of &#8364;218,059 ($249,543) and &#8364;278,828 ($307,492) in 2016 and 2015 respectively, at the request of the Spanish tax authorities. This is a customary request during the inquiry period. In November 2014, March 2015 and September 2015, the Company received partial refunds of the amount under dispute and continues to expect that this matter will be resolved in the Company&#8217;s favor.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7172 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT 28.8PT 0PT 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 22.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7174 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
<I>
	Spain Income Tax Audit
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7176 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7177 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	We are currently undergoing an income tax audit in Spain for the period from 2008 to 2014, when our Spanish branch was closed. The branch reported net operating losses for each of the years reported. We have not established any provision for losses related to this matter.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7178 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Operating Segments and Geographic Information
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7184 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7185 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	The Company&#39;s business consists of one segment as this represents management&#39;s view of the Company&#39;s operations. The Company operates on a worldwide basis with one operating company in the US and operating subsidiaries in the UK and in Australia. Revenues and expenses are generally attributed to the operating unit that bills the customers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7186 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; TEXT-INDENT: 22.5PT">

<TD ID=TBL3451S1.FINROW.3.TRAIL.D2 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM; PADDING-BOTTOM: 1PX">

<TD ID=TBL3451S1.FINROW.3.LEAD.D3 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">

<TABLE ID=TBL3451 STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; WIDTH: 95%; MARGIN-RIGHT: 5%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PX" CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0 BORDER=0>

<TD STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF; VERTICAL-ALIGN: BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>

	&nbsp;
</DIV>

<P ID=PARA7191.2 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA3305 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV DATA-TD-STATEMENT-TYPE="NOTE">
<P ID=PARA3305 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	(15
</B>
<B>
	)&nbsp;&nbsp;
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
<B>
	Subsequent Event
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7197 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7198 STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PT; MARGIN-TOP: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7199 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	On June 2, 2016, the Company entered into a securities purchase agreement, which was amended on June 7, 2016&nbsp;(as amended, the &#8220;Purchase Agreement&#8221;) with certain institutional purchasers (the &#8220;Purchasers&#8221;). Pursuant to the terms of the Purchase Agreement, the Company has agreed to sell an aggregate of 417,000 shares of Common Stock together with warrants to purchase up to an aggregate of 145,952 shares of Common Stock. Each share of Common Stock was sold together with a warrant to purchase 0.35 of a share of Common Stock at a combined purchase price of $4.60. The net proceeds to the Company from the offering were approximately $1.6 million, after deducting placement agent fees and estimated offering expenses payable by the Company, but excluding the proceeds, if any, from the exercise of the warrants issued in the offering. The warrants have an exercise price of $6.08 per share, will be exercisable on the date that is six months and one day from the date of issuance, and will expire five years following the date of issuance.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7200 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 21.6PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7201 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
	Pursuant to an agreement dated June 2, 2016 (the &#8220;Placement Agency Agreement&#8221;), the Company engaged Roth Capital Partners, LLC and Rodman &amp; Renshaw, a unit of H. C. Wainwright &amp; Co., LLC (the &#8220;Placement Agents&#8221;) to act as placement agents in connection with the issuance and sale of the shares and warrants. The Company paid the Placement Agents approximately $116,000 as placement agent fees in connection with the sale of securities in the offering. The Company also reimbursed the Placement Agents $35,000 for their out of pocket and legal expenses in connection with the offering.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ID=PARA7202 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN, TIMES, SERIF">
</FONT>
	&nbsp;
</P>
</DIV>
<P ID=PARA7202 STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
</P>
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT; MARGIN: 0PT; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0PX; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; MARGIN-TOP: 0PX; LINE-HEIGHT: 1.25; BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF">
	F-29
</P>
